content.description: Start directly below the first bolt located about 20 feet up. Continue to the top of the face, and move left around a corner to find a bolt line leading to anchors with rap rings.
content.protection: 6-8 bolts, a singles rack, and a 2 bolt anchor.
content.location: This is the route directly to the left of Ribula on the left side of Stack Factor Wall.

content.description:
I am unsure on the grade and name, definitely at least a 5.12.

It follows the lip of a huge roof for about 100 feet. Stick clip the first and probably second bolt. It is steeply overhung and nearly sideways from start to finish. It has sustained hard climbing, but there are some good rests. There are often good holds, but the angle is very awkward. Your left arm will be dead after this one. It's like a 90 foot heel hooking bouldering nightmare....

The rock looks suspect in a few places, but I've never seen anything actually loose or break.

Because of the angle, there are some potentially extremely dangerous falls if you swing into the wall with a lot of rope out. Have a good belayer. It is not runout but could end badly. I would wear a helmet on this one even if you can cruise it.
content.protection: I'm not sure on the count, but there are probably 9 or 10 bolts.

content.description:
Don't miss out on this this Taylor Canyon classic.

Thug your way through the overhang to access the delicate and beautiful face. Clip the last bolt and head to the chains. Keep it together or you'll be saying "Fuck Sake!"
content.location: This route is technically on Lower Stack Factor. There two bolted routes on this feature. Fuck Sake is the bolted line to the right.
